sense.name: artistic rhythmic movement of the body
sense.examples: Mary's daughter studied dance at a performing arts school. The ballerina has devoted her life to dance. There is a dance in the second act of the opera. The revelers cavorted in dance and song throughout the night.

sense.name: people assembled together in a rhythmic movement
sense.commentary: DANCE[+collection][+assemblage][+of_people][+in_movement][+rhythmic] Note: refers to the people engaged together in dancing.
sense.examples: John was Mary's partner in the square dance of eight people. A few onlookers joined the dance as it wove its way down the street.

sense.name: a specific sequence of rhythmic steps and movements
sense.commentary: DANCE[+process][+movement][+sequence][+step][+rhythmic] Note: related to Sense 1, but refers to specific sets of steps and movements
sense.examples: Betty taught her little sister the steps to several Latin dances. This dance is one step right, one step left, then three steps in place. The company is performing a new dance by the young French choreographer. The producer had to do a real dance to keep the director, the writer and the film stars all happy and working well together. (metaphoric usage)

sense.name: a social party where people move to music
sense.examples: Bob and John took Betty and Jane to the school dance. She attended most of the summer dances given by the country club.

sense.name: a type of musical composition
sense.examples: The composer wrote several waltzes, mazurka and other dances. This piece is a dance written in 3/4 waltz time.

sense.name: ritualistic mating behavior of animals
sense.examples: The male bird of this species does an elaborate dance to attract mates. We watched the big ungulates perform their mating dance.
